meanings.definition: Before the main event or action.
meanings.sent1: She checked her equipment preliminarily before the race.
meanings.sent2: The team met preliminarily to discuss their strategy.
meanings.sent3: Preliminarily, he double-checked his homework to avoid mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The birds chirped preliminarily, announcing the arrival of dawn.
meanings.sent5: The chef tasted the soup preliminarily to adjust the seasoning.

meanings.definition: As a preliminary step or measure.
meanings.sent1: They preliminarily reviewed the documents before the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The students were instructed to preliminarily outline their essays.
meanings.sent3: Preliminarily, she measured the ingredients for the cake.
meanings.sent4: The artist sketched preliminarily before starting the final painting.
meanings.sent5: The detective gathered evidence preliminarily to build the case.
